oai_dc:dc.dc:title: SPATIOTEMPORAL ANALYSIS OF VARIATIONS OF CERTAIN MORPHOLOGICAL BEACH FORMS
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Pruszak, Zbigniew
Schönhofer, Jan
RóÅ¼yÅ,,ski, Grzegorz
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: shoreline
dune foot
non-tidal sea
Baltic Sea
wavelet transform
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The study is focused on spatiotemporal shoreline variability at a beach with a wide surf zone featuring 3-5 bars based on field observations done between 1983-2008 in the south Baltic Sea. The implementation of various analyses from simple geometry, through spectral analysis up to Discrete Wavelet Transform (DWT) allowed for a synergistic description of simultaneous shoreline and dune foot variability in space and time. The results include meso-scale and long-term phenomena with time scales from several months to many years and spatial scales ranking between a few hundred meters up to several kilometers.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Coastal Engineering Proceedings; No. 33 (2012): Proceedings of 33rd Conference on Coastal Engineering, Santander, Spain, 2012; sediment.82
